org.apache.juneau.xml

Class XmlSerializerSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Session
      • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerSession
        • org.apache.juneau.xml.XmlSerializerSession
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HtmlSerializerSession

    public class XmlSerializerSession
extends SerializerSession
    Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of XmlSerializer.

    This class is NOT thread safe. It is meant to be discarded after one-time use.

    Author:
    James Bognar (james.bognar@salesforce.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmlSerializerSession

        public XmlSerializerSession(XmlSerializerContext ctx,
                            BeanContext beanContext,
                            Object output,
                            ObjectMap op,
                            Method javaMethod)
        Create a new session using properties specified in the context.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context creating this session object. The context contains all the configuration settings for this object.
        beanContext - The bean context being used.
        output - The output object. See JsonSerializerSession.getWriter() for valid class types.
        op - The override properties. These override any context properties defined in the context.
        javaMethod - The java method that called this parser, usually the method in a REST servlet.

      • getWriter

        public XmlWriter getWriter()
                    throws Exception
        Description copied from class: SerializerSession
        Wraps the specified output object inside a writer. Subclasses can override this method to implement their own specialized writers.

        This method can be used if the output object is any of the following class types:

        • Writer
        • OutputStream - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
        • File - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.
        Overrides:
        getWriter in class SerializerSession
        Returns:
        The output object wrapped in a Writer.
        Throws:
        Exception - If object could not be converted to a writer.
